title: (x) InSpec Intl. - Poppl Laudatio {Yves}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47876.jpg)


inspec-text.svg (131.6 k)
Everyone, Having a problem identifying the font this company uses for all their stationery. It looks in some ways like Albertus, but not exactly. Any ideas?
author: lq15

comments.content: I was going to suggest something like [Fago Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052941/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/fago-condensed/exb-lf-roman/testdrive.html?s=InSpec&p=48), which is close but the serifs and e are wrong.

That's pretty close, especially as far as weight goes, but getting this one right on is important to the client.   
I've tried Identifont and I've tried WhatTheFont!?, and WTF came up with Scala (which is close, but not 100%).   
So the search continues...
Yves, I think you're right but its been condensed maybe 5-10%
Oh I'm such a failure, I should have used the technical term here "Squooshed"ï¿½ Tiffany
